original: Lindberg, Johannes (John), civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 31/12/85 i Eskilstuna av byggm. Jan Erik L. o. Anna Larsson. G. m. Signe Qvist. Barn: Barbro, Karin. — Avg:ex. fr. CTH 10. Ing. v. A-B Skånska Cementgjut. i Gbg 10-14, ritkont:chef där 14-16, därefter konsult, verksamh. f. ind:byggn., grundläggn : frågor, byggn :konstr., idrottsanläggn. m. m. Konstr. o. uppf. ind:byggn. f. Aga, Bröd. Edstrand, Gunnebo Bruks A-B, Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B, Jonsereds Fabr. A-B, Nord. Syrgasverken, Sv. Suchard, Ahlafors nya spinn. A-B, Sv. Oljeslag. A-B m. fl., byggn :ko.nstr. f. bl. a. Gbgs centralpost o. stadsteat., jub:-utställn. i Gbg 23, flera skolhus, Rå-sunda fotb :stadion, restaur:arb. f. Gustav Adolfs o. Caroli kyrkor i Borås, Halmstads kyrka m. fl. Stud:re-sor t. Norge, Danm., Tyskl. o. Engl. Skr.: ett flertal upps. i byggn :tekn. tidskr. RVO.
translated: Lindberg, Johannes (John), civil engineer, Gothenburg, b. 31/12/85 in Eskilstuna to builder Jan Erik L. and Anna Larsson. M. to Signe Qvist. Children: Barbro, Karin. - Graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1910. Worked at A-B Skånska Cementgjuteriet in Gothenburg from 1910 to 1914 as an engineer. Became head of the drafting office there from 1914 to 1916, after which he worked as a consultant in industrial construction, foundation engineering, building design, sports facilities, etc. Designed and constructed industrial buildings for Aga, Bröd, Edstrand, Gunnebo Bruks A-B, Gamlestadens Fabriks A-B, Jonsereds Fabriks A-B, Nordiska Syrgasverken, Svenska Suchard, Ahlafors nya spinnare A-B, Svenska Oljeslageri A-B, and others. Involved in the construction of buildings such as the Gothenburg central post office and city theater, the 1923 jubilee exhibition in Gothenburg, several school buildings, Råsunda football stadium, restoration work for Gustav Adolf and Caroli churches in Borås, Halmstad church, among others. Undertook study trips to Norway, Denmark, Germany, and England. Wrote several articles in technical construction journals. Received the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa (RVO).

structured.name: Johannes Lindberg
structured.description: Johannes Lindberg was a civil engineer from Gothenburg, born on December 31, 1885 in Eskilstuna to builder Jan Erik Lindberg and Anna Larsson. He was married to Signe Qvist and had two children, Barbro and Karin. Johannes graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1910. He worked at A-B Skånska Cementgjuteriet in Gothenburg from 1910 to 1914 as an engineer and then became the head of the drafting office there from 1914 to 1916. He continued his career as a consultant in industrial construction. Johannes was involved in various construction projects, including designing and constructing industrial buildings for companies such as Aga, Bröd, Edstrand, Gunnebo Bruks A-B, Gamlestadens Fabriks A-B, Jonsereds Fabriks A-B, Nordiska Syrgasverken, Svenska Suchard, Ahlafors nya spinnare A-B, Svenska Oljeslageri A-B, and others. He also contributed to the construction of notable buildings like the Gothenburg central post office, city theater, Råsunda football stadium, as well as restoration work for Gustav Adolf and Caroli churches in Borås, Halmstad church, among others. Johannes undertook study trips to Norway, Denmark, Germany, and England and wrote several articles in technical construction journals. He received the Royal Swedish Order of Vasa (RVO).
